title: What will be the effect of virtual reality on society? - Quora

response.answer_text: As a VR enthusiast and an entrepreneur in the VR industry, I’d focus my answer around how VR would impact on people’s social interaction. In fact, although digital technologies (from phones, text messages, online social media, and online communities, to VR) seem like incremental: they just push folks to online interaction further and further and dilute face to face human interaction bit by bit, what’s interesting about VR is that the ‘virtual reality’ can be so real that it turns humans back to simulated face-to-face, interactive, multi-channel, and real-time social interaction that has been largely flattened by digital technologies so far. And, for sure, it would also propose brand new challenges on humans’ social interaction due to its uniqueness compared to simpler media.  In virtual environments, people both feel and act differently from in reality. They may act less responsible as there’s the less actual impact of their behaviors. On the flip side, they may act more confident due to the same reason. They may feel mentally uncomfortable because they are not familiar with the situation. On the flip side, they may also experience positive feelings that they would probably never get in real reality. In social VR, how one user feels would impact on how she acts. And how one user acts would, in turn, influence how other users feel. There is only a fine line between a virtuous loop and a vicious one or between a virtual utopia and a dystopia, and hardware or graphics or algorithms won't necessarily be the keys to VR that positively impacts on human interaction but clever UX designs, effective management, and, most importantly, to develop VR products based on what a target market group needs and to position the product correctly. The social market can be roughly divided into acquaintance socials and stranger socials. If you are a 360 VR creator, feel free to follow and request me any 360 or/and VR relevant questions! :)

It’s up to us. In Enterprise, it’s here to stay as it simply accelerates the industrial process at multiple steps. On the broader society, there is an almost inevitable Black Mirror / Ready Player one dystopian scenario, with millions of consumers combing their brain with all sorts of commercial and entertainment stimuli, as it is now, but more immersive… And there is the liberating factor of VR / XR where: headsets are used to give enhanced vision back to peopleNew tools empower arttists and designers to create dimensions not yet physically possibleHolographic communication becomes as good as teleportation.you can travel the world with google earth and streetview from your room (still doing it every now and then)Training programs in VR show amazing retention rates.you can show to people dimension, data and maybe explore the entire universe, in an immersive, holographic way.People with Addiction and PTSS are treated with VR programs attenuating physical medicationVR as a tool for human augmentation.It’s up to us, developers, to steer the tech in the right direction.

Let me show you  Social graph with people as node, interaction channel as edges. The small black rectangles represent VR HMDs. You are now one of those guy, connected to friends thanks to face to face interaction, mobile phone chats, website participations, etc. The more you interact with someone, the stronger your link to this person becomes and the weaker the links to others become. With VR you get yet another way to connect, et another way to disconnect. VR will reshape our social network thanks to our social interactions. How it will reshape it is up to us.

Virtual Reality - at least this generation - will have no significant effect on society. It will make a few enthusiasts very happy, it will get many laypeople to say “wow! neat!” but otherwise… Why do I say this? Because Virtual Reality has been around for more than 60 years and most people weren’t even aware of it. If it’s lucky, the impact will be almost as great as 3D upon gaming! You remember that, right? Yeah, me neither :( There may come a day where VR is transformational. Today is not that day. I’ll be pleasantly surprised if that day comes in this century.

There’s always a debate on the effects of virtual reality in our society, sometimes it is seen to be a threat and sometimes an opportunity. While research has made it clear that there are some adverse effects of virtual reality but there are some benefits as well. VR can help people in connecting with each other, improve their communication skill and give the user a detailed and awesome experience which any gadgets from the previous generation couldn’t. I think augmented reality may actually have a greater effect on our daily lives, but VR will play an extremely important role in pacifying the masses when AI and other technological advancements render the vast majority of the population unemployed In the short to medium term, however, it will be a transformational technology akin to the internet

Thank you for A2A. The society will have a new toy, companies will have new ways of generating revenue, we might see new ways of marketing, etc… Apart from that, I don’t anticipate a great effect on the society.

For one, if someone is making a living as a driving instructor, then s/he should start looking for a new job. In 5 years time, it could become obsolete like typist. Combined with AI, much of mechanical training could be done on computer.
